poem:
**First Class Fail**

Paper ships adrift, they sail
past schedule, through storms of delay.
Vows of swift sky turn pale,
time tethered, lost in mail's betraying sway.
Promised flights fall frail,
targets anchored—empty trail.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
